body_html:
I don't have an opinion on what the answer should be-just that it should be consistent whether or not 'inc' is an int or a float, and whether or not 'inc' is internal or external to the looo.
…
On Fri, Oct 20, 2017 at 6:07 PM andydavis1 ***@***.***> wrote: I could be missing something, but gradients of interval-valued functions are undefined. Can you explain your use case further? Or are you just looking for it to return None for this case, instead of some undefined nonsensical value? — You are receiving this because you authored the thread. body:
I don't have an opinion on what the answer should be-just that it should be
consistent whether or not 'inc' is an int or a float, and whether or not
'inc' is internal or external to the looo.
On Fri, Oct 20, 2017 at 6:07 PM andydavis1 <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> I could be missing something, but gradients of interval-valued functions
> are undefined. Can you explain your use case further? Or are you just
> looking for it to return None for this case, instead of some undefined
> nonsensical value?
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
